short_summary: Telemedical Assistance Service for the Canadian Coast Guard
description: The International Convention on Maritime Search and Rescue requires the Joint Rescue Coordination Centre (JRCC) and Maritime Rescue Sub Centre (MRSC) to provide a maritime Telemedical Assistance Service (TMAS) to vessels operating within its Search and Rescue Region (SRR) 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year
tags: International Convention on Maritime Search and Rescue
full_summary:
# Telemedical Assistance Service for the Canadian Coast Guard

## Solicitation Details
- **Title (English)**: Telemedical Assistance Service for the Canadian Coast Guard
- **Title (French)**: Service d'assistance télémedicale pour la Garde côtière canadienne
- **Reference Number**: cb-5271-54434475
- **Solicitation Number**: 30004104
- **Last Amendment Date**: 2023-06-07
- **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-06-07 13:00:00
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: 2023-07-01
- **Expected Contract End Date**: 2027-06-30

## Contract Overview
The Canadian Coast Guard requires a Telemedical Assistance Service (TMAS) to provide 24/7 medical assistance to vessels operating within its Search and Rescue Region (SRR).

## Relationship to Health Services
- **UCI (Universal Classification of Industries)**: 85100000
- **Description (English)**: Comprehensive health services
- **Description (French)**: Services de santé complets

## Obligations and Requirements
- **Period of Contract**: 4 years
- **Option to Extend**: Up to 3 additional 1-year periods
- **Contract Security Requirements**: Valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and approved document safeguarding at the level of Protected B issued by Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)
- **Supply Chain Security**: Compliance with Contract Security Manual (latest edition) and security guidelines

## Important Notes
- The contractor must hold a valid DOS with approved document safeguarding at the level of Protected B issued by PWGSC.
- Subcontracts containing security requirements must be awarded with prior written permission from PWGSC.
- The contractor must comply with the Contract Security Manual (latest edition) and security guidelines.

## Bidding and Contact Information
- **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
- **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
- **Contracting Entity**: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
- **Contact**: Sara Gould, (506) 470-6349, DFO.Tenders-Soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

## Additional Resources
- **Attachments**: Accessed via CanadaBuys.ca
